questions.text: A 51-year-old woman complained to her gynecologist of persistent vaginal burning and vaginal pain during intercourse. One year earlier, the woman had undergone a total hysterectomy because of a large leiomyoma. Physical examination showed dryness and atrophy of the vagina. A vaginal cream was prescribed. Which of the following drugs would be appropriate for local therapy in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ethinylestradiol Total hysterectomy includes the removal of the ovaries. Vaginal dryness and atrophy due to estrogen deficiency is a common causes of dyspareunia (painful vaginal intercourse) and can be cured with estrogen administration. Topical forms of estrogens ( creams, vaginal tablets , etc.) are as effective as or more effective than oral forms for this indication and are usually preferred. When estrogen cream is used, women with a uterus are also given a progestin(to prevent endometrial hyperplasia) , which is not needed following a hysterectomy , as in this case. SERMs like ospemifene are also used in the treatment of atrophic vaginitis.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Ulipristal- it is a ‘selective progesterone receptor modulator’ (SPRM) used as an emergency contraceptive. Option: C & D. Aromatase inhibitors (AIs), e.g. letrozole and Tamoxifen are the established hormonal treatment options for breast cancer.

questions.text: A 57-year-old woman complained to her physician of increasing tiredness, a dry cough, and a lump in her right breast. The woman had a history of a hormone-positive carcinoma of her left breast 15 months earlier, for which she had a mastectomy and 3 months of chemotherapy. She had been taking tamoxifen . Magnetic resonance imaging revealed multiple pulmonary and liver metastases. Which of the following drugs would be appropriate to treat the metastatic cancer of this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Anastrozole Early-stage breast cancer is However, this patient developed metastases , and the goal of treatment shifted from cure to palliation and stabilization of the disease. Anastrozole is a selective inhibitor of aromatase , the enzyme that converts androgens to ( The low levels of estrogens in postmenopausal women are produced by the aromatization of adrenal and ovarian androgens.) Aromatase inhibitors cause almost a total suppression of estrogen levels. They are Effective in tamoxifen failure cases of advanced breast Ca. Greater delay in disease progression and greater survival advantage in the palliative treatment of advanced/ metastatic breast Ca

Highyeild:

Comparative properties of tamoxifen (SERM) and letrozole/anastrozole (AIs) Tamoxifen Letrozole/Anastrozole Estrogen antagonist in breast and blood vessels, but agonist in uterus, bone, liver and pituitary Inhibits production of estrogens in all tissues. Nearly total estrogen deprivation. Can be used for breast Ca. in premenopausal women as well. Not to be used in premenopausal women Less effective in delaying recurrence when used as adjuvant therapy after surgery. More effective in delaying the recurrence of early-stage breast Ca. (adjuvant therapy). Prophylactic use for breast Ca. recurrence is usually limited to 5 years. Continues to exert prophylactic effect beyond 5 years. Less delay in disease progression and lower survival advantage in advanced/metastatic breast Ca. than AIs Greater delay in disease progression and greater survival advantage in the palliative treatment of advanced/ metastatic breast Ca Not effective in failure cases Effective in tamoxifen failure cases of advanced breast Ca Causes endometrial hyperplasia, predisposes to endometrial carcinoma No endometrial hyperplasia/cancer predisposition. No bone loss, no increase in fractures or arthritic symptoms Accelerates bone loss, predisposes to fractures, arthritic symptoms Increases risk of venous thromboembolism No increase in thromboembolic risk. Improves lipid profile; small lowering of LDL Ch No effect on lipid profile

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B, C & D. have no role in Breast cancer management.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman complained to her gynecologist of heavy and painful menstruation over the past 3 months. Further exams led to the diagnosis of uterine fibroids, and the patient was scheduled for surgery. Which of the following drugs would be appropriate to decrease the patient’s symptoms before surgery?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Medroxyprogesterone

Highyeild:

For symptomatic fibroids, medical options are focused on suppression of estrogen stimulation, but results are limited. Progestins such as medroxyprogesterone can partially suppress estrogen stimulation, which in turn can decrease fibroid growth and vaginal bleeding. Danazol, an androgen agonist, can also suppress fibroid growth but has a high rate of adverse effects like hot flushes , and is less frequently used.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Estrogens -such as ethinylestradiol are contraindicated in uterine fibroids because they stimulate uterine growth and bleeding. Option: B. Finasteride inhibits dihydrotestosterone By decreasing androgen activity, these drugs can indirectly enhance estrogen actions and are therefore contraindicated in uterine fibroids. Option: C. Mifepristone is a progestin antagonist and therefore is contraindicated in uterine fibroids.

Extraedge:

PROGESTERONE DERIVATIVES Medroxyprogesterone acetate Megestrol acetate Dydrogesterone Hydroxyprogesterone caproate Newer compound Nomegestrol acetate 19-NORTESTOSTERONE DERIVATIVES Estranes Norethindrone (Norethisterone) Lynestrenol (Ethinylestrenol) Allylestrenol Gonanes Levonorgestrel Desogestrel Norgestimate Gestodene

questions.text: During her annual checkup, a 32-year-old woman was found to have mild hypertension (160/90 mm Hg). The woman, otherwise healthy, had started an oral contraceptive (ethinyl estradiol and norgestrel) 2 months earlier. The physician decided to change her contraceptive pill and prescribed ethinyl estradiol and drospirenone. Increased excretion of which of the following ions most likely occurred in this patient after a few days of therapy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sodium Drospirenone -It is structurally related to spironolactone and acts as an aldosterone receptor antagonist. Therefore, it causes an increased renal sodium excretion , which can account for its diuretic and antihypertensive effects.

Highyeild:

Rise in BP among women taking OCPs Occurred in 5–10% of women taking the earlier pills. This again is less frequent and smaller in magnitude with the low-dose pills of today. If the BP rises, best is to stop OCPs : the BP normalizes in the next 3–6 months. Both the estrogen and progestin components are responsible for this effect, probably by increasing plasma angiotensinogen level and renin activity which have been found to be raised during OCP use. Aldosterone secretion is enhanced resulting in salt and water retention. Drospirenone is the only progestin drug with significant antihypertensive It is structurally related to spironolactone and acts as an aldosterone receptor antagonist. Therefore, it causes an increased renal sodium excretion , which can account for its diuretic and antihypertensive effects.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Potassium excretion is decreased , not increased, by aldosterone antagonists. Option: C & D. The renal excretion of these ions is minimally affected by drospirenone.

Extraedge:

PROGESTERONE DERIVATIVES Medroxyprogesterone acetate Megestrol acetate Dydrogesterone Hydroxyprogesterone caproate Newer compound Nomegestrol acetate 19-NORTESTOSTERONE DERIVATIVES Estranes Norethindrone (Norethisterone) Lynestrenol (Ethinylestrenol) Allylestrenol Gonanes Levonorgestrel Desogestrel Norgestimate Gestodene

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman asked her physician for a postcoital contraceptive 2 days following unprotected intercourse. Which of the following drugs would be most appropriate for this purpose?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Levonorgestrel Levonorgestrel, a progestin compound, is an effective postcoital contraceptive. The effectiveness is most likely due to a combination of effects of interaction with progesterone receptors and the time of the cycle. Among the contraceptive actions are inhibition of ovulation , alterations in cervical mucus production, and decreased fallopian tube motility, all of which can hinder fertilization and/or disrupt the development of an endometrium suitable for implantation . It can be given up to 72 hrs after unprotected

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A, B, & D. have no role in emergency contraception. Option: A. Clomiphene- is an antiestrogen used in infertility. Option: B. Leuprolide- this long-acting GnRH agonist is injected c./i.m. daily or as a depot injection once a month for palliation of carcinoma prostate along with an androgen antagonist , as well as for other conditions needing long-term gonadotropin suppression. Option: D. Fulvestrant - ‘ selective estrogen receptor down-regulators ’ (seeds) or ‘ pure estrogen antagonists ’ that have been introduced for the treatment of locally advanced or metastatic er-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women which has stopped responding to tamoxifen.

Extraedge:

Levonorgestrel, a progestin compound, is an effective postcoital contraceptive. The effectiveness is most likely due to a combination of effects of interaction with progesterone receptors and the time of the cycle. Among the contraceptive actions are inhibition of ovulation , alterations in cervical mucus production, and decreased fallopian tube motility, all of which can hinder fertilization and/or disrupt the development of an endometrium suitable for implantation . It can be given up to 72 hrs after unprotected intercourse.

questions.text: A 59-year-old woman diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer started a treatment that included anastrozole. Which of the following molecular actions most likely mediated the therapeutic effect of the drug in the patient’s disease?

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of conversion of androgens to estrogens

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibition of conversion of androgens to estrogens
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Inhibition of conversion of androgens to estrogens Aromatase inhibitors are considered second-line agents for hormone-dependent breast cancers, but they are increasingly used in this disease in postmenopausal women, in whom they cause an almost total suppression of estrogen synthesis. Anastrozole and letrozole are selective inhibitors of aromatase , the enzyme responsible for the conversion of androgens to estrogens , including the extra-adrenal synthesis of estrogen from androstenedione , which takes place in several tissues, including the breast.

Highyeild:

Estrogens and related drugs- The estrogens, its receptor agonists and antagonists, and synthetic blockers are classified in the following chart. Estrogens Natural Estradiol Estrone Estriol Synthetic Steroidal Ethinylestradiol Mestranol Tibolone Non-steroidal Diethylstilbestrol Hexestrol Dienestrol Antiestrogens Clomiphene citrate Selective estrogen receptor down regulator Fulvestrant Selective estrogen receptor modulator(SERM) Tamoxifen citrate Toremifene Raloxifene Aromatase inhibitors Letrozole Anastrozole Exemestane

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B, C are incorrect about Anastrozole.

questions.text: A 29-year-old woman had been taking a combined oral contraceptive pill for the past 5 years. However, she recently developed a disorder that prompted her physician to withdraw the pill and recommend other forms of contraception. Which of the following disorders most likely occurred to this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vein thrombosis Thromboembolic disease is an absolute contraindication for the use of a combined oral contraceptive pill. The estrogen component of OCPs has been mainly held responsible for venous thromboembolism, while both estrogen and progestin have been blamed for the arterial phenomena. The mechanisms involved may be Increase in blood clotting factors (coagulability is enhanced) Decreased antithrombin III Decreased plasminogen activator in endothelium Increased platelet aggregation Progestin-only contraceptives may be used in women with thromboembolic In such cases; IUCDs are preferred.

Highyeild:

The combined oral contraceptive pill is absolutely contraindicated in Thromboembolic, coronary, and cerebrovascular disease or a history of it. Moderate-to-severe hypertension; hyperlipidaemia. Active liver disease- hepatoma or h/o jaundice during a past pregnancy. Suspected/overt malignancy of genitals/ breast . Porphyria. Impending major surgery—to avoid the excess risk of postoperative thromboembolism. Estrogen-containing contraceptives should be stopped 4 weeks before surgery. Relative contraindications (requiring avoidance/ cautious use under supervision) Diabetes: control may be vitiated. Obesity Smoking Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding Uterine leiomyoma : may enlarge with estrogenic preparations; progestin only pills can be used. Mentally ill Age above 35 years Mild hypertension Migraine Gallbladder disease

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Rheumatoid arthritis is not a contraindication for the use of OCPs rather OCPs are Option: C. Vaginal infection is not a contraindication for the use of OCP rather estrogen help in overcoming the vaginal infection. Option: D. Acne is not a contraindication for the use of OCP rather estrogen benefits by suppressing ovarian production of androgen by inhibiting Gn release from the pituitary . Cyclic treatment (with added progestin) in girls is quite

Extraedge:

Mini Pill (Progesterone Only Pill) - NORETHINDRONE - Used in Lactating mother Sickle cell anemia Seizures Smokers > 35 yr old Increased Venous Thromboembolism

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with a long history of chronic cardiac failure presented to his physician complaining of urinary hesitancy and frequent need to urinate during the night. An examination revealed an enlarged prostate and further exams confirmed the diagnosis of benign prostatic hyperplasia. Finasteride was included as part of his therapeutic regimen. Which of the following actions most likely mediated the therapeutic effect of the drug in the patient’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibition of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH) release

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Inhibition of 5α-reductase enzyme Finasteride is a competitive inhibitor of 5α-reductase , the enzyme that converts testosterone to dihydrotestosterone . Finasteride blocks only type 1 of the 5-α-reductase enzyme. Dutasteride blocks both types 1 and 2 of the 5-α-reductase enzyme. Uses of Finasteride- Benign prostatic hyperplasia Hirsutism Male pattern baldness

Highyeild:

Dihydrotestosterone is the principal androgen responsible for stimulation of prostatic growth . The definitive therapy of benign prostatic hyperplasia is surgical A transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) , but drugs can be used when surgery is contraindicated.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options: A, B, and D. are incorrect about finasteride.

Extraedge:

Principal androgen for different target tissue actions Testosterone Dihydrotestosterone Pituitary: LH inhibition Testes: Spermatogenesis Internal genitalia (epididymis, vas deferens, seminal vesicle) development in foetus. Erythropoiesis ● External genitalia (scrotum, penis, male urethra) formation in foetus and maturation during puberty ● Pubertal changes, sexual maturity, male behaviour ● Prostate growth; hypertrophy in elderly ● Hair follicles: growth during puberty, scalp hair loss in adults Bone and skeletal muscle: increase in mass and strength

questions.text: A 54-year-old woman presented to her physician complaining of hot flashes and night sweats that disturbed her sleep. Her last menstrual period was 6 months ago. The physician prescribed a hormone replacement therapy with a combined contraceptive pill (ethinyl estradiol and norethindrone). This therapy might carry a small increase in the risk of which of the following diseases?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Breast cancer Hormone replacement therapy is the most effective treatment option for alleviating vasomotor symptoms ( hot flushes and night sweats) in postmenopausal women . The risk of malignant tumors in women taking hormonal contraceptives is probably the major concern for the use of these medications in perimenopausal women.

Highyeild:

Adverse effects of Oral Contraceptive Pills/Hormone replacement therapy- Non Serious side effects- Nausea and vomiting Headache Mild Precipitate migraine Breakthrough bleeding /spotting Especially with Progestin-only pills Breast discomfort Late side effects- Weight gain, acne, increased body hair Chloasma Pruritus vulvae Carbohydrate intolerance precipitation diabetes Mood swings Mental depression Abdominal distension Serious complications - Leg vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism Coronary and cerebral thrombosis Myocardial infarction Stroke Estrogen component are responsible Increase in blood clotting factor decreased antithrombin3 decreased plasminogen activator in endothelium increased platelet aggregation Rise inBP Genital carcinoma Increased vaginal, breast, cervical cancer Benign hepatomas Gallstones

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A, B & D . OCPs are beneficial in patients with these conditions.

Extraedge:

Current conclusions regarding HRT The main indication of HRT is vasomotor and other symptoms in women before the age of 60 years or within 10 years after menopause. It should be used at the smallest effective dose and for the shortest duration. Young women with premature menopause clearly deserve HRT at least till the age of natural menopause. Hysterectomized women should receive estrogen alone, while those with intact uterus be given estrogen + progestin. The option of low-dose estrogen alone may be tried, if symptomatically effective. Perimenopausal women should be given cyclic HRT rather than continuous HRT. HRT is not the best option to prevent osteoporosis and fractures, but may be used in women <60 years of age. HRT affords protection against coronary artery disease only in early postmenopausal women. Combined HRT at conventional dose may increase the risk of venous thromboembolism, MI and stroke in elderly women. HRT does not protect against cognitive decline; may increase the risk of dementia. Combined HRT increases the risk of breast cancer, gallstones and migraine. Transdermal HRT may have certain advantages over oral HRT. The need for HRT should be assessed in individual women, and not prescribed routinely.

questions.text: A 27-year-old woman who was having trouble trying to conceive started a cycle of therapy with clomiphene. Eight weeks later, she had a positive pregnancy test. Which of the following was most likely the primary site of action of the drug that led to the woman successfully becoming pregnant?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hypothalamus Hypothalamus acts by Blocking of estrogen receptors in the hypothalamus.

Highyeild:

Clomiphene citrate - An estrogen receptor antagonist in most target tissues. Blockade of estrogen receptors in the hypothalamus counteracts the estrogen-induced negative feedback on the hypothalamic-pituitary-ovarian axis. This effect often allows normal pulsatility of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) release from the hypothalamus to occur, stimulating a normal pattern of follicle-stimulating hormone(FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH) release from the anterior pituitary. In response, the ovaries enlarge & ovulation Uses- For infertility due to failure of ovulation 50 mg once daily for 5 days starting from the 5th day of the cycle. To aid in vitro fertilization Oligozoospermia- 25 mg daily given for 24 days in a month with 6 days rest for upto 6 months has been recommended. Adverse effects- However, clomiphene may exhibit negative effects, including an increased incidence of multiple births, ovarian cysts, and ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome. Usg ovary showing Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome Polycystic ovaries Hot flushes d/t peripheral estrogen antagonism gastric upset Vertigo Allergic dermatitis

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C, and D are incorrect about Clomiphene.

questions.text: A 54-year-old woman had been receiving tamoxifen for 1 year following surgery for breast cancer. Which of the following drug classes best denotes this drug?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Selective estrogen receptor modulator Tamoxifen is a Selective estrogen receptor modulator.

Highyeild:

Estrogens and related drugs- The estrogens, their receptor agonists and antagonists, and synthetic blockers are classified in the following chart. Estrogens Natural Estradiol Estrone Estriol Synthetic Steroidal Ethinylestradiol Mestranol Tibolone Nonsteroidal Diethylstilbestrol Hexestrol Dienestrol Antiestrogens Clomiphene citrate Selective estrogen receptor down regulator Fulvestrant Selective estrogen receptor modulator(SERM) Tamoxifen citrate Toremifene Raloxifene Aromatase inhibitors Letrozole Anastrozole Exemestane

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option:A. Anastrozole- is used in metastatic breast cancer but is an aromatase inhibitor , not an estrogen receptor antagonist. Options: B & C . These drugs are not used in the therapy of breast carcinoma.

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman asked her physician for a contraceptive pill. Because the woman had suffered in the past from deep venous thrombosis, the physician prescribed a progestin-only oral contraceptive (the mini pill). Which of the following actions most likely contributed to the contraceptive effect of the prescribed drug?

options.label: A
options.text: Activation of progestin receptors in the corpus luteum

options.label: B
options.text: Stimulation of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) release from the pituitary

options.label: C
options.text: Increased viscosity of the cervical mucus

options.label: D
options.text: Increased frequency of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) pulse generator

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased viscosity of the cervical mucus
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Increased viscosity of the cervical mucus In patients with Venous thromboembolism, IUCD is a contraceptive of choice . Among the oral contraceptives- Progestin-only pills(mini-pills) can be used. These pills increase the viscosity of cervical mucus , which decreases sperm penetration

Highyeild:

Progestin-only oral contraceptive (the mini pill)- The effectiveness of these preparations is thought to be mainly related to a combination of effects, including a) Increased viscosity of cervical mucus , which decreases sperm penetration. b)a decrease in fallopian tube motility ( estrogens increase but progestins decrease tube motility) c) endometrial alterations that impair implantation.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Activation of progesterone receptors in the corpus luteum- has nothing to do with the contraceptive effect. Option: B. Stimulation of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) release from the pituitary-Progestins do not enhance follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) release; if they did, this effect would favor , not inhibit, ovulation. Option: D. Progestins decrease , not increase the frequency and increase the amplitude of pulsatile gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) release.

Extraedge:

Mini Pill (Progesterone Only Pill) - NORETHINDRONE - Used in Lactating mother Sickle cell anemia Seizures Smokers > 35 yr old Increased Venous Thromboembolism

questions.text: A 21-year-old woman complained to her physician of recurrent nausea lasting most of the day. The woman had been suffering from a urinary tract infection presently being treated with ciprofloxacin and from gastroesophageal reflux disease presently being treated with omeprazole. She also routinely took ibuprofen during her menstrual period. One week ago, she started taking a contraceptive pill (ethinyl estradiol and norgestrel). Which of the following drugs most likely caused the patient’s nausea?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ethinyl estradiol Nausea from a combined oral contraceptive can generally be attributed to the estrogen component (ethinyl estradiol) . It was a common adverse effect and was one of the main reasons for discontinuing the use of combined contraceptives. Today, with the use of low-dose contraceptive pills , this adverse effect is much less common.

Highyeild:

Adverse effects of Oral Contraceptive Pills- Non Serious side effects- Nausea and vomiting Headache Mild Precipitate migraine Breakthrough bleeding /spotting Especially with Progestin only pills Breast discomfort Late side effects- Weight gain,acne,increased body hair Chloasma Pruritus vulvae Carbohydrate intolerance precipitation diabetes Mood swings Mental depression Abdominal distension Serious complications - Leg vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism Coronary and cerebral thrombosis Myocardial infarction Stroke Estrogen component is responsible Increase in blood clotting factor decreased antithrombin3 decreased plasminogen activator in endothelium increased platelet aggregation Rise inBP Genital carcinoma Increased vaginal, breast, cervical cancer Benign hepatomas Gallstones

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B, C, D. Many drugs can cause nausea and vomiting in sensitive patients. However, the woman was most likely suffering from nausea due to the contraceptive preparation , as she had been taking the other drugs for some time without adverse effects.

questions.text: A 60 -year-old woman with postmenopausal atrophy And hot flashes is prescribed estrogen therapy by her primary care physician. Progestin-only history of Endometrial cancer and is concerned about her risk For this condition. Which of the following statements Is true?

options.label: C
options.text: The risk can be offset by adding a progesterone Product

questions.correct_answer: C. The risk can be offset by adding a progesterone Product
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A.Estrogens- can be associated with an increased risk of breast cancer. Option: B. Postmenopausal bleeding is possible with estrogen preparations because of endometrial proliferation. Option: D. Thromboembolic events are possible with estrogen preparations.

Postmenopausal bleeding is possible with estrogen preparations because of endometrial proliferation. Option: D. Thromboembolic events are possible with estrogen preparations.

Extraedge:

Current conclusions regarding HRT The main indication of HRT is vasomotor and other symptoms in women before the age of 60 years or within 10 years after menopause. It should be used at the smallest effective dose and for the shortest duration. Young women with premature menopause clearly deserve HRT at least till the age of natural menopause. Hysterectomized women should receive estrogen alone, while those with intact uterus be given estrogen + progestin. The option of low-dose estrogen alone may be tried, if symptomatically effective. Perimenopausal women should be given cyclic HRT rather than continuous HRT. HRT is not the best option to prevent osteoporosis and fractures, but may be used in women <60 years of age. HRT affords protection against coronary artery disease only in early postmenopausal women. Combined HRT at conventional dose may increase the risk of venous thromboembolism, MI and stroke in elderly women. HRT does not protect against cognitive decline; may increase the risk of dementia. Combined HRT increases the risk of breast cancer, gallstones and migraine. Transdermal HRT may have certain advantages over oral HRT. The need for HRT should be assessed in individual women, and not prescribed routinely.

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman requests birth control. She has no medical conditions, and she smokes one pack of Cigarettes per day. Which would be the most appropriate to recommend?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Progestin-only “mini-pill” Progestin-only products are preferred in older women who are smokers, due to a lower risk of severe adverse effects, such as myocardial infarction and Estrogen -containing contraceptives are not recommended in women over the age of 35 who are smokers.

Highyeild:

Mini Pill (Progesterone Only Pill) - NORETHINDRONE - Used in Lactating mother Sickle cell anemia Seizures Smokers > 35 yr old Increased Venous Thromboembolism

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A, B, D . The vaginal contraceptive ring, transdermal contraceptive patch, and combination oral contraceptive pills all contain estrogen .

Extraedge:

Uses of progesterone derivatives- As contraceptive Hormone replacement therapy Dysfunctional uterine bleeding Endometriosis Premenstrual syndrome/tension Threatened/habitual abortion Endometrial carcinoma

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with a history of myocardial infarction and angina has a prescription for sublingual Nitroglycerine but has not taken it. He now complains of erectile dysfunction and is given a prescription for Sildenafil 50 mg. He is warned by his physician not to take sildenafil and nitroglycerine because of which of the following possible reactions?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hypotension Nitrate+PDE 5 inhibitors (Sildenafil ) → Increased cGMP → Vasodilation → Hypotension, Increased Heart rate, Myocardial Infarction. Hypotension is most common among these drug interaction reactions.

Highyeild:

Management of Erectile dysfunction- PDE 5 inhibitors- Indications- Erectile dysfunction Pulmonary hypertension e.g., Sildenafil Tadalafil Vardenafil Avanafil Mechanism of action- pharmacokinetics- Take 1-2 hr before sexual contact. Drug interaction- Nitrate+PDE 5 inhibitors→ Increased cGMP→ Vasodilation→Hypotension, Increased Heart rate, Myocardial Infarction. Adverse Drug reaction- Hypotension Increased Heart rate Blue green-tinted vision (PDE6 inhibition in the retina) Androgen replacement Pharmacologically induced penile erection (PIPE), otherwise known as cavernosal unstriated muscle relaxant injection (CUMRI) Injectable Papaverine/Phentolamine induced penile erection. Alprostadil-PGE1 injectable.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Myocardial infarction -would be a rare side effect. Profound hypotension is much more common. Option: C. Retinitis pigmentosa- is a hereditary condition and is not induced by the combination of medications. Option: D.Tinnitus -is unlikely . Headache and hypotension would be expected.

questions.text: An obstetrician wants to do a Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) for a patient with an unwanted pregnancy. She wants to prescribe her with an anti-progesterone. Which of the following is an anti-progesterone?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mifepristone Among the given options only Mifepristone is an anti-progesterone.

Highyeild:

Eg.of SPRMS -Selective progesterone receptor modulators MIFEPRISTONE Progesterone Partial Agonist and Antagonist Glucocorticoid Receptor Antagonism Rx MTP, Abortions Emergency contraceptive Endometriosis Fibroids Cushing’s syndrome Progesterone receptor-positive breast cancers Meningeoma ULIPRISTAL Emergency Contraceptive 300mg

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Gossypol is a nonsteroidal compound, obtained from cotton seed . It causes suppression of spermatogenesis & reduces sperm motility -infertility develops after a couple of months. Fertility is restored several months after discontinuation. Hence it is used as a male contraceptive. Option: C. Atosiban is an oxytocin antagonist found to suppress premature uterine contractions & postpone preterm delivery. Option: D. Clomiphene citrate is an anti-estrogen used for infertility due to failure of ovulation .

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ovarian cancer Risk of ovarian tumor is increased hence not used in ovarian cancer.

Highyeild:

Clomiphene citrate - An estrogen receptor antagonist in most target tissues. Blockade of estrogen receptors in the hypothalamus counteracts the estrogen-induced negative feedback on the hypothalamic-pituitary-ovarian axis. This effect often allows normal pulsatility of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) release from the hypothalamus to occur, stimulating a normal pattern of follicle-stimulating hormone(FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH) release from the anterior pituitary. To aid in vitro fertilization Oligozoospermia- 25 mg daily given for 24 days in a month with 6 days rest for up to 6 months has been recommended. Adverse effects- However, clomiphene may exhibit negative effects, including an increased incidence of multiple births, ovarian cysts, and ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome. Usg ovary showing Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome Polycystic ovaries Hot flushes d/t peripheral estrogen antagonism gastric upset Vertigo Allergic dermatitis

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B, D. are an indication for using Clomiphene citrate

questions.text: A woman in menopause was started with Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT). The HRT benefits all of the following except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Coronary heart disease Progesterone components of HRT tend to raise LDL and lower HDL cholesterol levels & therefore predispose to increased risk of MI.

Highyeild:

Current conclusions regarding HRT The main indication of HRT is vasomotor and other symptoms in women before the age of 60 years or within 10 years after menopause. It should be used at the smallest effective dose and for the shortest duration. Young women with premature menopause clearly deserve HRT at least till the age of natural menopause. Hysterectomized women should receive estrogen alone, while those with intact uterus be given estrogen + progestin. The option of low-dose estrogen alone may be tried, if symptomatically effective. Perimenopausal women should be given cyclic HRT rather than continuous HRT. HRT is not the best option to prevent osteoporosis and fractures, but may be used in women <60 years of age. HRT affords protection against coronary artery disease only in early postmenopausal women. Combined HRT at conventional dose may increase the risk of venous thromboembolism, MI and stroke in elderly women. HRT does not protect against cognitive decline; may increase the risk of dementia. Combined HRT increases the risk of breast cancer, gallstones and migraine. Transdermal HRT may have certain advantages over oral HRT. The need for HRT should be assessed in individual women, and not prescribed routinely.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Estrogen component of HRT can reverse hot flushes ( Option A ), vaginal atrophy & dryness ( Option B ), and osteoporosis ( Option C) .

questions.text: A 28-year-old female came to the gynecology OPD with C/O not being able to conceive even after 2 years of unprotected sexual intercourse. The doctor decided to induce ovulation for her by giving Clomiphene citrate. How should the drug be given to this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: On alternate days over the last two weeks of the menstrual cycle

options.label: C
options.text: Cyclically for 3 weeks with one week gap

options.label: D
options.text: Daily from 5th to 10th day of menstrual cycle

questions.correct_answer: D. Daily from 5th to 10th day of menstrual cycle
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Daily from 5th to 10th day of menstrual cycle For infertility due to failure of ovulation , Clomiphene citrate is given at 50 mg once daily for 5 days starting from the 5th day of the cycle.

Highyeild:

Clomiphene citrate - An estrogen receptor antagonist in most target tissues. Blockade of estrogen receptors in the hypothalamus counteracts the estrogen-induced negative feedback on the hypothalamic-pituitary-ovarian axis. This effect often allows normal pulsatility of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) release from the hypothalamus to occur, stimulating a normal pattern of follicle-stimulating hormone(FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH) release from the anterior pituitary. In response, the ovaries enlarge & ovulation occurs. Uses- For infertility due to failure of ovulation 50 mg once daily for 5 days starting from the 5th day of the cycle. To aid in vitro fertilization Oligozoospermia- 25 mg daily given for 24 days in a month with 6 days rest for up to 6 months has been recommended. Adverse effects- However, clomiphene may exhibit negative effects, including an increased incidence of multiple births, ovarian cysts, and ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome. Usg ovary showing Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome Polycystic ovaries Hot flushes d/t peripheral estrogen antagonism gastric upset Vertigo Allergic dermatitis

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A, B & C. are incorrect about Clomiphene citrate

questions.text: A 39-year-old female came with C/O heavy menstrual bleeding with clots lasting for 9 days. The doctor wants to prescribe her a SERM. Which of the following SERM can be used for this dysfunctional uterine bleeding?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ormeloxifene Ormeloxifene is a SERM approved for use in dysfunctional uterine bleeding.

Highyeild:

Centchroman (Ospemifene) - Nonsteroidal SERM(Selective Estrogen Receptor Modulator) an oral contraceptive. It has predominant estrogen antagonistic action in the uterus and breast with little action on the vaginal epithelium and cervical mucus. Endometrial proliferation is suppressed by down-regulation of endometrial ER. Contraceptive action is probably due to uterus-embryonic asynchrony and failure of implantation. For contraception- 30 mg twice a week for 12 weeks followed by once a week. Excessive bleeding attending anovulatory cycles is diminished & it is also approved for use in dysfunctional uterine bleeding. Side effects: Nausea, headache, fluid retention, weight gain, rise in BP & prolongation of menstrual cycles. Chhaya (8-centchroman tablet ) is provided free by the government of India.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Tamoxifen- is a SERM that acts as a potent estrogen antagonist in breast carcinoma cells, and blood vessels & at some peripheral sites, but as a partial agonist in the uterus, bone, liver & pituitary. It is used in ER-positive breast cancer. Option: C. Toremifene is a newer congener of tamoxifen with similar actions, but is a weaker ER agonist. Uses & adverse effects are also similar. Option: D. Raloxifene is a SERM which is an estrogen partial agonist in bone, on lipid metabolism & CVS, but an antagonist in endometrium & breast . It prevents bone loss & increases bone mineral density (BMD) in postmenopausal women. Hence it is a second-line drug for the prevention & treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women.
